conversation.text: Hi! Hope you're good! Would you like to make peanut butter frosting for cupcakes?
Hello, thank you I am good! Yes, I'm excited and ready to start the recipe!

Wonderful! Let's get started! First you want to place the butter, peanut butter, and sugar into a bowl and use a mixer until the mixture becomes light and fluffy. Be sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl every once in a while.
evidence: Place them in a medium bowl and use a mixer to cream the butter, peanut butter and sugar until the mixture becomes light and fluffy, about two minutes
Scrape down the sides of the bowl every once in a while

conversation.text: Okay, how much of each ingredient should I use? Also, does it matter which kind of sugar I use?
You'll want to use 5 tablespoons of butter, 1 cup of peanut butter, and 1 cup of sugar. It's advised to use powdered sugar.
Okay, that's perfect as I've got powdered sugar. I've mixed all the ingredients now and the mixture is nice and fluffy. What should I do next?
Perfect! Next, you'll want to add 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract and 1/3 cup of heavy cream to the bowl. Grab your mixer and mix them in thoroughly.
evidence: Add the vanilla and cream to the bowl and mix them in thoroughly with your electric mixer.

conversation.text: Okay, I've added the vanilla extract and heavy cream; this is starting to smell really good! After mixing, what's the next step?

That sounds great! It'll taste delicious! Now you'll want to switch to a normal whisk and beat the mixture manually for three minutes, or until it is slightly stiff. You want to make sure it's not too thick.
evidence: Keep beating until the frosting is slightly stiff

conversation.text: I've beaten the mixture for three minutes now. It seems to be slightly stiff now but not too thick. I'm happy with the consistency and it looks good to me! Should we move on?
That's good. All you have to do now is spread it on to your cupcakes and enjoy! Make sure you wait until the cupcakes are completely cool however first, or else the frosting will melt and slide off.
evidence: You can spread it on with a knife or pipe it on in swirls
Make sure you wait until the cupcakes are completely cool before you frost them; otherwise, the frosting will melt and slide off

conversation.text: Oh great. My cupcakes have just cooled down so I'll start spreading the frosting on them now. I can't wait to try these as they look fantastic and smell even better. Thank you for your help today!
Of course no problem! Have a fantastic day and enjoy!
Thank you, I hope you have a great day as well!
Thank you, I hope you have a great day as well!

recipe.title: How to Make Peanut Butter Frosting for Cupcakes

procedure.summary: Cream the butter, peanut butter and sugar.
procedure.description: Place them in a medium bowl and use a mixer to cream the butter, peanut butter and sugar until the mixture becomes light and fluffy, about two minutes. Scrape down the sides of the bowl every once in a while to make sure everything gets mixed in.

procedure.summary: Mix in the vanilla and cream.
procedure.description: Add the vanilla and cream to the bowl and mix them in thoroughly with your electric mixer.

procedure.summary: Beat the mixture for three minutes.
procedure.description: This will help you achieve the right light, fluffy, spreadable texture you want for your cupcake frosting. Keep beating until the frosting is slightly stiff. If the frosting seems too thick, add another tablespoon of cream and keep beating. If it seems too runny, add another 1/4 cup of powdered sugar and keep beating.

Peanut butter frosting is classically paired with peanut butter, chocolate or  vanilla cupcakes. You can spread it on with a knife or pipe it on in swirls, and it will hold its shape until you're ready to eat the cupcakes. Make sure you wait until the cupcakes are completely cool before you frost them; otherwise, the frosting will melt and slide off. Store extra frosting in the refrigerator for up to three days.
